markdownRemark.html:
Material possessions depreciate the moment you buy them. But travel? It appreciates over time. The memories strengthen, the lessons learned compound, the connections made deepen. Years later, you'll forget what you spent, but you'll remember every sunset, every conversation, every moment of wonder.

Travel wealth isn't measured in souvenirs but in perspectives gained. You return home seeing your own culture with fresh eyes. You appreciate differences while recognizing our shared humanity. You become more empathetic, more curious, more comfortable with uncertainty.

The richest people aren't those with the biggest houses or fanciest carsâ€”they're the ones with passport stamps, local friends across continents, and stories that captivate dinner guests. They've invested in experiences that shaped them, rather than things that simply surround them.

frontmatter.title: Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer
frontmatter.excerpt: Invest in experiences that expand your mind and enrich your soul.
frontmatter.author: admin

authorsJson.name: Alex Thompson
authorsJson.bio: Magazine editor and lifestyle writer passionate about fashion, food, and travel. Sharing stories that inspire and inform through thoughtful journalism and creative storytelling.

frontmatter.title: The world is a book, and those who don't travel read only one page
